oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Confederate soldier John Lafayette Lemonds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing to "Esteemed Friends" in Georgia Mrs. Carrie Diamond and Miss Rosalie Webster, 1st Lt. John L. Lemonds of Co. C, 5th Inf. CSA describes his experiences in the latter part of the war. He recounts marching "to meet the advancing hosts under Sherman"; and refers to battles of Resaca, New Hope Church, Kennesaw Mountain, Decatur and Jonesboro: "they have left a bloody mark across the bosom of your noble state." Writes: "my own section [of TN] is given up to the merciless control of a band of marauders."
